summary: This document is an email chain from October 2021 discussing attempts to contact an attorney representing a victim in Epstein-related matters. It involves coordination between legal professionals regarding representation and communication about case issues, including unsealing and protective order matters in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.role: Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: Attorney representing a victim in Epstein-related matters pro bono and coordinating with other lawyers regarding case communication and representation issues.

persons.name: Robert Y. Lewis
persons.role: Attorney at The Marsh Law Firm PLLC
persons.context: Attorney who is helping a victim with unsealing/protective order issues in the v. Maxwell case, as his contact information is provided by Sigrid McCawley.

connections.description: McCawley indicates Lewis is helping her client on specific legal issues (unsealing/protective order) in the Maxwell case, suggesting a collaborative attorney relationship.
McCawley states she represents a victim pro bono on Epstein-related matters, establishing a direct attorney-client relationship.

events.title: Email Forwarding Regarding Attorney Communication
events.description: An email from an attorney was forwarded to a full team, with a note that 'MI was handling' the matter.

events.title: Request for Call Regarding Victim's Attorney
events.description: Sigrid McCawley requests a quick call to discuss connecting with the attorney representing a victim.

events.title: Clarification of Legal Representation
events.description: Sigrid McCawley clarifies her pro bono representation of a victim and refers to Robert Lewis for assistance on Maxwell case issues.

locations.address: 401 E. Las Olas Blvd. Suite 1200 Fort Lauderdale, FL, 33301
locations.context: Law office address for Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, where Sigrid McCawley works.

keyFacts: Sigrid McCawley was providing pro bono legal representation to a victim in Epstein-related matters as of October 2021.
Robert Y. Lewis of The Marsh Law Firm was assisting the same victim with unsealing and protective order issues specifically related to the v. Maxwell case.
There was apparent miscommunication or lack of response to an attorney who had been emailing about the victim's case for months prior to October 2021.
The email chain shows ongoing legal coordination and case management among attorneys for Epstein victims years after Epstein's death.
